alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 17 at 7:51PM MST until August 17 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Dust Advisory for... North central Pima County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 915 PM MST. * At 750 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Avra Valley to 8 miles southwest of Three Points, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Route 86 between mile markers 110 and 146. Locations impacted include... Sells, Avra Valley, San Isidro, Kitt Peak, Ali Chukson, Fresnal, San Pedro, Queens Well, Comobabi, Cababi, South Comobabi, Santa Rosa Ranch, Sil Nakya, Artesia, Pan Tak, Rincon, Ali Molina and Silver Bell. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
